Class LooseState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.controller.State.AdventureState
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.controller.State.SlaversStates.LooseState
public class LooseState extends AdventureState
Represents the state where a Player has lost a combat against the Slavers during the AdventurePhase of the game. In this state, the player must pay the penalty by choosing which crew members to sacrifice, distributing the losses across available HousingUnits. After resolving the crew loss:
  • If all players have taken their turns, the state transitions to IdleState.
  • Otherwise, the next player will face the Slavers in a new SlaversState.

    • LooseState

      public LooseState(AdventurePhase advContext, Player player)
      Constructs a new LooseState, representing the penalty phase for a player who lost against the Slavers.
      Parameters:
      advContext - the context of the current adventure phase.
      player - the player who lost the combat.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the drawn card is not of type Slavers.

  • Method Details

    • killMembers

      public Player killMembers(String username, Map<HousingUnit,Integer> housingUsage)
      Allows the player to assign losses by selecting which crew members to sacrifice across their ship's HousingUnits.

      Validates the user and ensures that the player does not sacrifice fewer crew members than required. If this happens, the player is considered eliminated.

      Once resolved, the game either advances to the next player or ends the current adventure phase.

      Overrides:
      killMembers in class AdventureState
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player making the sacrifice.
      housingUsage - a mapping from each HousingUnit to the number of crew to be killed.
      Returns:
      the updated Player object after resolving the losses.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the username is not correct.
      IllegalStateException - if the number of crew members killed is not sufficient.
